column4: does anybody know, if Skype audio input (of the static-oss version) does work with padsp?
if it is really static linked (all libs linked into it), no
I got the static-oss version from skype.com
i don't use skype at all. but you can do ldd /path/to/skype to check it.
if it gives you something like "statically linked", you are out of luck
then it is not statically linked
ok, all it says is static-oss on the download page
what beli says, nopaste the output of ldd
it should work with padsp if padsp uses the same technique as aoss
how do you see that. which lib am I looking for?
output works, but skype does seem to believe, there is no mic
it is dynamically linked agains libc. and if padsp works like aoss, it will intercept the open() system call
then i suspect it is a pulseaudio problem. i don't use PA, just plain alsa
I can record from the mic via pulseaudio, with the gnome-recorder app, or whatever its name is
so pulseaudio seems to work correctly
then i don't know, must be skype specific...
i refuse to use this closed source rubbish
